# Creativity for All

Uniquely simple and fun 3D creation! Sketch out shapes, add color and style, then export for game engines, 3D printing, social apps, or just for show. You'll be amazed how easily you can create truly original worlds, objects, and even characters.

![{"height":400,"type":"image","width":2560}](https://scontent.oculuscdn.com/v/t64.5771-25/75230050_429633753319452_4272255071443212433_n.png?_nc_cat=105&ccb=1-7&_nc_sid=6e7a0a&_nc_ohc=Zl1Yy7qhyyIQ7kNvgF6E5Uv&_nc_ht=scontent.oculuscdn.com&_nc_gid=A9qeSsuGehxsUp168fsi-QI&oh=00_AYCaZGxWXPPxiYwy9M0ovKR5A3y8GhO0qkPJul6eMRWlVQ&oe=66EC023D)

# Export and Share

- **Social Creators**, build custom world and avatar art
- **Game Designers**, sketch levels and prototype objects quickly
- **3D Artists**, enjoy as a truly awesome retopo tool
- **Concept Artists**, screenshot your creations for easy paint-overs

# Features

- Simple, intuitive "sketch" 3D modeling. Just sketch the lines, connect to form surfaces. No "relative space axis constraint gizmo handles" mumbo-jumbo here.
- Import 3D models and images for reference
- Export specific objects, or the entire scene, for use with just about any other app (Blender, Unity, Unreal, Roblox, VR Chat, etc)
- Multiplayer (Alpha) - bring friends into your creations, live!

# Community

Join any of our communities to discuss new features, share your creations, and get inspired.

changelog.change_log:
- fixed bug where you end a line on another point, it aligns visuall but doesn't actually connect
- made loop-detection smarter so when drawing you are more likely to get the face you expect

- made the app free! Limited to 3 saves, but free!
- added a purchase to get unlimited saves.  Users that bought the app previously should get this for free
- fixed image references
- a few additional minor bug fixes

Switching to free app with 3 saves. Buy upgrade for unlimited saves.
If you purchased the app previously, you should get the unlimited saves for free. If you do not, tell us on discord https://discord.gg/ZJZqSsEr

- added Save As functionality
- Changed samples to be editable. You can then reset them, and save as to make a copy.
- several small bug fixes

- added new-user onboarding!!
- Lots of small bug fixes.
- further ux tweaks

- Moved file save location. Due to impending Android changes, we had to change where we store your files.  We used to keep all our files in <root>/Polysketch. 
-- Exports and ReferenceImages will be moved to Documents/Polysketch.
-- All other files will be moved to Andoird/data/com.PolysketchLLC.Polysketch/files.
-- If you update from an older version of the app, all files should be moved for you, but it's recommended to check in a file browser to make sure.
-- All old files will be backed up to <root>/Polysketch_backup. If everything works great, you can delete that folder. If you have issues, you can use it to restore data. polysketchvr.com for more info

- Left handed mode! 
- - Note that the menu button (the three dashes on the left hand) will always be on the left hand unless you swap it and the Oculus button from your Oculus home settings (outside our app). 
- Added reference image and model access. Place images or models in your scene's save folder, or in Polysketch/ReferenceImages or Polysketch/ReferenceModels respectively. 
- Added two new menu areas: 
- - Image Import. Used to find images as reference images to help your drawing. Browse all images found in above mentioned folders. Select an image to make it active. Pulling down on the thumb stick will grant quick-access to a zoomed-in view of the active image. Clicking the active image (when zoomed in) will place it in the scene.
- - Incomplete Features. A place for us to put some features that are rough for now. We'll use this space for user testing, or when making a feature that isn't quite ready for mass consumption.  Currently the only feature here is toggling visiblity of any found reference models.

- Frames are framerating with so much more frameness! Improved performance, especially when zooming in or having lots of shapes covering the view
- Changed drawing-on-face visuals to use actual transparency because it looks cooler. 
- You can now undo a color changes
- When selected objects have their colors changed, the selection highlight remails intact. 
- The little blue dots that help you manually face a face now properly scale with the world.

- Export to glTF!!! Now when you export shapes or scenes, you will see a .glb file. This is glTF format which includes better hierarchy and color management than obj. 
- Simplified default scene naming.
- Corrected colors on export to properly handle Linear/Gamma color space conversion (the colors now look right).

- Created a new helper-pane instead of the old in-scene tutorial videos. Point at any action to get info on it. Click the left hand joystick to hide/show the new pane. 
- The exported pivot is now locked for a give shape. If you export one shape, you will always get the same pivot despite shape edits. If you export more than one shape, the pivot will be the world origin.

- Passthrough!!!  You can now toggle passthrough on and off in the main menu or the in-scene menu.
- When drawing a shape, lines are now slightly 3D instead of flat. This improves performance as well as visibility of lines.

- Face chopping, slicing, and dicing!  Hover on an existing poly face (while editing the shape) to begin drawing new geometry into the face.
- Now supports Quest Pro.
- Redesigned undo system - now undo will sometimes revert larger groups of actions, but will be far more robust.

- Zoom! Enhance! Degauss sub-pixel variance matrix! Er, I mean - we flipped some switches and now the text, icons, and geometry edges should be much crisper. Enjoy!
- Changed the 'outline' feature to only turn faces on. To turn a face off, just hover and hit Delete (B)
- Minor bug fixes...
  - Fixed laser rendering issues in main menu
  - Fixed color issues if you hovered a face, then stopped editing a poly shape. 
  - Fixed issue where shape deletion could break other-shape hover
  - Fixed face-creation so that if you merge two neighboring corners of a face, the face will remain with the new smaller shape
  - Fixed a few "It all stops working" scenarios (couldn't hover, draw, etc.)

- When doing an extrude of multiple faces, we are now smarter about how the new & old faces should be connected. It used to make a weird waffle pattern if you did things a certain way. Now no more waffles!
- Fixed bug with save files for people in comma instead of dot cultures ("one and a half" being 1,5 or 1.5)
Apparently navigating then drawing could blow up everything. Now that's fixed.

- Moved all save files, exports, and imports to a folder called Polysketch at the root of the Quest's filesystem
- During face extrude, we now hide the original face if that face is attached to any other faces. We only keep it if it is a stand-alone face.
- Added ability to hover a line or face to select it. Included in this is that grabbing a line or face that is selected will grab entire selection
- Added release info in main menu
- Updated selection visuals while editing a polyshape to be a bit cleaner
- Set up OBJ loading to default to a gray material if the MTL file is missing.
- Made draw a line across an existing face to split it be undone with one undo instead of two
- Added new scene button to bottom of main menu
- Added Labs button to main menu get info on experimental features
- Fixed bug where new scenes sometimes didn't get a valid icon set during save
- Fixed tutorial pane being throw-able
- Fixed bug involving hand-to-object distance calculations when hovering some shapes

- Added an "edit shape" button to the left hand menu. Select a shape, open the menu, begin editing it.
- Fixed bug where icon in main menu would change size randomly
- Fixed bug where selection got stuck during reentry of scene
- Fixed left hand menu tooltips and button states when they are tied to selection (like disabling Delete when nothing is selected)
- Fixed bug involving deleting vertices and refreshing the shape's face
- Fixed bugs with selection being stuck going in and out of editing shapes
- Fixed bug where invalid "ObjectInclude" obj files would mess up scene during load
- Drawing a single line across an existing face will now split that face into two smaller faces. Undo once will undo the face change but not the line. Second undo will undo the line as well.
- Fixed bug where converting from the two-file save (icon's separate) to one file lost the old icon.
- Fixed bug where exports were scaled & rotated based on your view of them in the scene rather than their actual transform.

- When deleting a scene, we now also delete the scene folder if empty.
- Export files are now saved to a folder called PolysketchExports at the root level of your Quest file structure.
- A single reference OBJ can be shown in your scenes by including it in a folder called ObjectInclude at the same file structure depth as our SaveFiles. See https://www.polysketchvr.com/learn/ for instructions
- Now saving icon inside scene save file. This means autosaves will include the icon.
- Better hover/select visuals.
- Small tweak to analytic data.
